study_plan_entry.title: Laser Processing of Materials: From Optical Properties of Materials and Light-Matter Interaction to Applications

free_text.Content: 1) Principles of laser operation, types of lasers[br/]2) Properties of the laser light: light controlled in time and space[br/]3) Optical properties of the materials and their physical origin at atomic level[br/]4) Fundamentals of light-matter interaction: linear/non-linear absorption, refractive index,  influence of light properties such as wavelength or pulse length on the process[br/]5) Laser light delivery: imaging, focusing, high resolution patterns - beam quality, resolution limits[br/]6) Principles of laser processing: efficiency, importance of understanding heat flow, serial processing, parallel processing, ... [br/]7) Applications of laser processing in micro-technique: welding, cutting, drilling, ablation, ...[br/]8) Generative techniques: sintering, 3D-lithography, laser induced CVD[br/]
free_text.Keywords: Lasers, laser processing, optical properties, light-matter interaction
free_text.Note: Course schedule: 6-8 September 2011 lecture at EPFL, 12-13 September 2011 praktical work at EMPA, Thun (splitted in groups, each student only one of the days), 14 September 2011 students presentations and lecture at EPFL
